alert.note: Alert for Allen; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:52AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wilson, Neosho, Woodson and Allen Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 650 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Chanute, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rain will reduce visibility and create ponding water on roadways. There will be an increased risk of hydroplaning. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Iola, Neodesha, Fredonia, Humboldt, Yates Center, Erie, St. Paul, La Harpe, Gas, Moran, Thayer, Altoona, Toronto, Buffalo, Walnut, Neosho Falls, Galesburg, Savonburg and Elsmore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
